author: Shoumojit Banerjee
text:
Five students of the Film and Television Institute of India (FTII) staged a hunger strike here on Tuesday in protest against the suspension of five Dalit students of the University of Hyderabad that led to the suicide of the research scholar Rohit Vemula.The FTII Students Association said in a statement that the students had been “viciously targeted” by the university administration and right-wing groups on a ‘false complaint’ from Susheel Kumar, president of the ABVP.

It condemned the police action against students protesting after Vemula’s suicide and demanded the resignation of Vice-Chancellor Appa Rao and Union Minister Smriti Irani.

“Minority communities are attacked, voices of dissent are suppressed and Brahmanical ideology is imposed on cultural and educational spaces,” it said.
title: Hunger strike at FTII
